Advice to Management
-I would tie pay, (and bonuses), of the uppermost management to the lowest paid employee such that the uppermost pay would not exceed 30 times what the lowest paid employee makes, but only if it could be applied across the whole nation otherwise we may end up discouraging top talent at the upper levels.

-I would also, rethink outsourcing. If we pay another company to do work that we routinely need done or depend on, because the outsource company is able to do it cheaper then I would question if that part of the company is running efficiently. Somewhat like, IF Toyota can come to the US, build cars for less, that are safer, more efficient, and / or last longer than US companies on our "home turf", then companies like GM should be asking why are we getting beat, instead of asking for government handouts or loans. If we as a company can't do the work needed more efficiently then by all means bring in someone else, but I would try to understand why we can't and not just leave it at, "we are not in the ..... business, we are in the bio-pharma business.

Lastly I would consider stretching the working hours of the facilities for 2 reasons:
1 - to better accommodate working families work schedule.
2 - to accomplish more in the same 7 day week by minimizing wait times and optimizing functionality and overlap the same way people do by working from home and responding to e-mails at 8 or 9 pm so the person on the other end doesn't have to wait for that respondent to come in before getting a reply. 
The buildings and labs are already here being powered and cooled all seven days. If people are in them and are able to spread their 40+ hours of work, efficiently, over 80+ hours instead of ~55 hours more work can be accomplished with the right timing choices. 

 Instead of the typical 8-5 or 9-6, I would have the parts of the company that can be up and running open from 6 am until 8 pm. Mon. - Sat. I would ask that people still work their 40+ hours, I would just give them more time to do it in. This sort of schedule could help avoid traffic and work around weather issues like snow.
